blocks.text: The CFT1 is a 5-band (40m, 30m, 20m, 17m, 15m) QRP CW field transceiver designed by KM4CFT for portable POTA and SOTA operation. Features approximately 5W class-D transmitter, message memory playback, and iambic keyer with paddle reverse.
Front panel controls: LCD display with 6 tactile buttons, rotary encoder for VFO tuning, and volume potentiometer (with white stripe on knob). The slide switch controls power.
Band selection and other functions are controlled via the menu system accessed by the front panel buttons. The radio stores last-used frequency for each band.
The CFT1 is a kit radio. Refer to the assembly manual for build instructions. This section covers operation after successful assembly and calibration.
Access the menu by pressing the menu button. Use the rotary encoder to navigate and press the encoder knob to select options.
The calibration menu (accessed by rotating encoder counterclockwise from menu) contains critical settings for proper operation.
Built-in iambic keyer with paddle reverse option. Message memory playback available. Connect paddles to the 3.5mm jack.
Keyer modes include Straight Mono and Straight Stereo depending on your key type. Select the appropriate mode in the menu.
The CFT1 uses a 4-crystal ladder filter for IF selectivity. RIT (Receive Incremental Tuning) is available by long-pressing the VFO knob.
When RIT is enabled, adjust the RIT offset with the encoder. The display shows the RIT offset value. Typical peak audio occurs between +/-0.10 kHz offset.
The CFT1 operates from 12V DC via the barrel jack (5.5x2.1mm). A polyfuse and reverse polarity protection circuit protect against wiring errors.
When transmitting during PA calibration, limit key-down time to 5-second bursts since the IRF510 may not yet be connected to the heatsink.
The CFT1 does not include an internal antenna tuner. Use an external tuner for non-resonant antennas. Connect antenna to the BNC jack.
Most issues during or after assembly relate to soldering. Carefully inspect all joints with magnification.

blocks.name: LCD not visible
blocks.description: Adjust contrast using trimpot RV4 with small Phillips screwdriver. Turn clockwise to increase contrast. Be gentle with the trimpot.

blocks.name: No power output
blocks.description: Verify PA calibration was completed correctly. Check RV1 (power level) and RV2 (PA drive) settings. Gate voltage should be 2-2.5V when transmitting.

blocks.name: Frequency appears off
blocks.description: Perform 10 MHz reference calibration using an accurate receiver. Use the calibration menu to adjust the reference.

blocks.name: Audio peaks at wrong RIT offset
blocks.description: Perform IF frequency calibration. Adjust IF value in calibration menu until audio peaks at RIT = 0.

blocks.text: For issues not covered here, visit HamGadgets.com/pdf for the troubleshooting guide or contact KM4CFT/RadioDan for support.
